page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area is south of York,east of Leeds and north-west of Selby. It is very flat with few single trees or hedges, instead the fields are bordered by drainage dykes. As a result the land looks very bare in winter. The R.A.F. influences life in the area as an employer and by the noise that the planes make. The main London to York railway line now runs through the west of the area having been diverted away from the Selby coalfield. The area contains the edge of Church Fenton village but no other large settlements.There are farms and isolated houses scattered over the block with little in the way of public transport or amenities.
